div.span: anastasia.aizman@gmail.com is now known as Anastasia A.
anastasia.aizman@gmail.com is now known as Anastasia A.

message.div: I was thinking about that PR
you should have a "if change X-kinda thing I need to sanity check it" policy
i have that set up with greg on any build-related stuff
whenever I make a change to any part of the build process (npm, grunt, setup-stuff), I have to double-check it and have greg make sure that it doesn't break anything.
everything else is basically just merged in without question
idk what that would be with you guys, though, since your job is cross-stack
if you want to cover your bases with this past PR, you could talk to k about doing it with any api keys
other than that you could say "any customer payments stuff"
you should pinpoint any super-important customer stuff (payments is the only one I can think of, but any IP or personal identification is also fair game)
and just say, "these should never have only one set of eyes on them"

div.span: that pretty much covers all of the code
ugh god this protractor stuff is really hard

message.div: I'm pretty happy that I don't have to test yet

div.span: i'm trying to ssh into circleci's session and set up a tunnel so that i can see what protractor is trying to test

message.div: that seems like the right thing though
so it works on local, but not on circle, right?
maybe rebuild everything in a new folder on your local
see if you can replicate the problem there?
nothing? it still works on your local?

div.span: k recommended testing webdriver, not protractor
but i'm pretty lost about how to do it
OMG I just realized who that person was that i saw her
i mean not here, when we were biking
he used to work in newsbound
i guess he left apozy or whatever
don't know why i thought his art was shit.....
oh! i think he showed me his sketchbook or something

message.div: my day is going pretty good!
I think I just finalized the whole class-based thing I was working on
we have a meeting at 4:30 to discuss
i don't really want to be down there anymore

div.span: i'm pretty tired of this bleh

message.div: just got out of my big meeting

div.span: she was disappinted that it was such a "stab in the dark" process
and then she chided me for not having just started using a repo that worked
something that i was doing until she told me to do something else
i'm kind of pissed, but i know i shouldn't be
it's fucking hard, this circle stuff

message.div: but that shit wasn't easy at all!
did she pull a k and just make it work instantly?

div.span: she asked me a bunch of questions all of which i had answers for
and then she told me she was disappointed

message.div: I dunno what to say — that sucks a lot

div.span: i just shouldn't have asked for help, i should have just kept going
another reason i didn't think that working on the phonecat app was a good idea — it's way bloated
as soon as i updated stuff everything broke, now trying to figure out what the problem is is hard

message.div: you should be able to ask for help whenever you want
would you want me to help?

div.span: it's just ugggghhhh she doesn't even know what i've tried
and for her to make the blanket statement of "you just shoot in the dark"
it's not all dramatic or whatever

message.div: it doesn't matter if its dramatic or not!
i want you to take care of yourself

div.span: i might need to work though
i'll see you tomorrow, i guess?

message.div: can i sleep over tonight too : )
well I'll see you later today then

div.span: gonna go right now take a break before diving into this again
i don't hitnk i have anything to eat
maybe i'll stop on the way to get a couple things or something
i wasn't checking in the app.js files
because i wrote the app with no circleci in min
and then k was like, how about instead of integrating protractor into our real app, integrate it in here
after i left it alone for a few weeks
but also, fuck everything i am pissed
i know it's my fault, but i'm still made
if she didn't hand hold me through like every possible thing, and i didn't need to write a mockapp for every possible thing, i wouldn't even be in this mess
because instead of hacking my way through a mockapp in order to be quicker about it, i'd just be working with our setup
that took a really long time to make
you can't possibly duplicate every single bit of a real app in a mock app
and if you're trying to make things work for your production code why the fuck would you spend so much time seeing if a thing works in a completely unrealistic scenario
i know it's my fault, i know

message.div: you should mention that the next time she gives you a project like that
and you'll never know what the real problems are until you're really in it
doing mock apps is great for seeing if you want to pick which technologies you want to use

div.span: i mean this never ever ever would have occurred on the production code
and while this is good to know for the future, how actually applicable is it?
so next time i want to run protractor on a coffee app inside of circle, i'll know to look at gitignore

message.div: if you ever need to talk to me — i'm here
feel free to ask me anything

div.span: i just deleted all of our users
trying to restore all right now
i just called k , i'm such an idiot
i think i need a break
i don't get what i'm supposed to do!
i'm looking at words and they don't make sense

message.div: okay then take a quick break
you need a backup — do you have one?

div.span: i'm supposed to be running mongod though right?
mongod --help for help and startup options
